title: The future of materials - Deloitte
summary: Eastman Chemical Company has developed two chemical-recycling projects to address the triple challenge of climate change, the global water crisis, and caring for the global population. The first project uses Carbon Renewal Technology (CRT) to recycle most complex waste plastics into syngas, which is then used to produce acetic acid and other acetyls. The second project uses Polyester Renewal Technology (PRT) to break down PET into MEG and DMT, which Eastman further manufactures into specialty copolyesters. Eastman's chemical-recycling processes reduce waste and emissions, and help customers meet their recycled-content and sustainability goals.
green_innovation: TRUE, Eastman's chemical-recycling projects are green innovations because they reduce negative environmental externalities of human activity by reducing waste and emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE, Eastman's chemical-recycling projects are business innovations because they are new and improved business processes that differ significantly from the firm's previous business processes and have been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: TRUE, Eastman's recycled plastics are green products because they are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, Eastman's chemical-recycling processes are green processes because they are methods or techniques in manufacturing, production, or any other operational activity that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
product_or_process: Carbon Renewal Technology (CRT) and Polyester Renewal Technology (PRT)
likely_naics_codes: ['325199: All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing', '325211: Plastics Material and Resin Manufacturing', '326199: All Other Plastics Products Manufacturing', '562998: All Other Miscellaneous Waste Treatment and Disposal']
greenwashing: FALSE, Eastman's chemical-recycling projects are not an example of greenwashing because they are not false or misleading statements about the environmental benefits of a product or practice.

title: First Person Perspective: Carpet is the feedstock of the future - Resource Recycling
summary: Recent technological developments have transformed post-consumer carpet from a difficult waste stream into a valuable feedstock for new products. Advances in mechanical and chemical recycling have led to a dramatic increase in the yield of recycled carpet material, exceeding 76% in California. These recycled materials are used in a wide range of products, including automotive components, construction materials, and new carpet, contributing to a more circular economy.

business_innovation: TRUE, because the article describes new products and processes that differ significantly from previous offerings and have been brought to market.
green_product: TRUE, because the article describes products that are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, because the article describes processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability, such as reducing waste and energy consumption.

title: Mono-Material Lipstick Tubes - Trend Hunter
summary: Quadpack's Emerald is a new mono-material tube for lipsticks and other cosmetic products, made from either recyclable PET or rPET up to 100%. Mono-material packaging is becoming increasingly popular among sustainably minded beauty brands, as it is easier for consumers to recycle and reduces waste.

title: With New Recycling Center Fully Operational, EGGER Now Manufactures Products With Post-Consumer Recycled Wood - PR Newswire
summary: EGGER Wood Products, a leading manufacturer of wood-based materials, has opened a new recycling center in Lexington, North Carolina, allowing them to offer particleboard and thermally fused laminate (TFL) made with up to 15 percent post-consumer recycled wood. Most of the wood material in EGGER's U.S.-produced boards is waste wood from sawmill residues and pre-consumer recycled material, and approximately 90% of the wood supply for the Lexington plant originates within a 100-mile radius to reduce carbon impact from transport.
green_innovation: TRUE. The recycling center allows EGGER to produce particleboard and TFL with up to 15 percent post-consumer recycled wood, contributing to environmental sustainability goals by reducing resource consumption and promoting a circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE. The new recycling center represents a significant investment in business process innovation for EGGER Wood Products, allowing them to adopt and modify digital technologies to enhance the efficiency and sustainability of their production processes.
green_product: TRUE. The new particleboard and TFL products made with up to 15 percent post-consumer recycled wood are green products, as they are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The new recycling process implemented by EGGER Wood Products is a green process as it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by reducing waste, conserving natural resources, decreasing energy consumption, and limiting the release of harmful substances into the environment.
likely_naics_codes: ['321212 - Particle Board Manufacturing', '321999 - All Other Wood Product Manufacturing', '423830 - Wood Container and Pallet Manufacturing', '562920 - Material Recovery Facilities']
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not provide any evidence of greenwashing, as the described product and process innovations are genuinely sustainable and environmentally beneficial.

title: CPI Announces Keynote Speaker for 2023 Polyurethanes Technical Conference - American Chemistry Council
summary: Debbie Mielewski, a sustainability expert and former Technical Fellow of Sustainability at Ford Motor Company, will deliver the keynote speech at the 65th Polyurethanes Technical Conference on Sept. 25, 2023 in San Antonio, TX. Mielewski is a pioneer in the field of sustainable materials development, and her work has led to the development of over 15 industry-first, sustainable materials that have appeared on Ford vehicles. In her keynote speech, Mielewski will share her vision for the future of sustainability in the polyurethanes industry and discuss the challenges and opportunities that lie ahead.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article states that Mielewski pioneered a biomaterials program at Ford in 2000, and her team was the first to demonstrate a soy-based foam that met all the requirements for automotive seating.

green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a specific green process.

title: Role of R&D in achieving sustainable goals - Indian Chemical News
summary: The chemical industry must focus on sustainable practices and green technologies to meet changing consumer preferences and increasing regulatory focus on ESG and climate risk. R&D will play a crucial role in developing sustainable solutions, such as green chemistry, to reduce environmental impacts. Green chemistry aims to design and develop chemicals and processes that reduce or eliminate the use and generation of hazardous substances, minimize environmental impacts, and promote economic growth.

green_product: TRUE, The article mentions the development of sustainable coatings, safer chemicals in the agrochemical industry, and green processes in the oil and gas industry, which can all be considered green products as they aim to reduce environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
green_process: TRUE, The article emphasizes the importance of green chemistry in developing sustainable processes, such as microwave chemistry, surfactant-mediated reactions, and flow chemistry, which can be considered green processes as they aim to reduce waste, conserve resources, and minimize environmental impacts.

title: Samuel Ross joins Beats by Dre - HYPEBAE
summary: British artist and designer Samuel Ross has joined Beats as its first-ever Principal Design Consultant. Ross will shape the brand’s industrial design strategy, focusing on new products and packaging incorporating sustainable materials, premium finishes and thoughtful color selection. In 2021, Ross collaborated with Beats on the highly sought-after Studio3 Wireless design, which achieved global sellout.

title: How Up-Fuse is turning plastic waste into trendy fashion - Gulf Business
summary: Up-fuse is an e-commerce brand that sells products made from upcycled plastic waste. The company was founded in 2013 by Lama El Khawanky and Karim Abouelnaga. Up-fuse has been featured in the United Nations Climate Change Conference 2022 (COP27) and has collaborated with Adidas and the International Organization of Migration.

title: Next generation gantry sees BAT UK help retailers keep up in fast-moving alternative nicotine products landscape - Grocery Trader
summary: BAT UK is launching a new sustainable gantry solution to help retailers navigate the fast-changing alternative nicotine market. The gantry is made from 100% recycled plastic and a selection of wood and metal that makes it lighter in weight than previous solutions. All materials used to make the gantry are sourced from within a radius of 50km of the Barcelona site and their reuse or recycling means there’s zero wastage from the manufacturing process.
